title: Am I responsible for my mom's ambulance bill and hospital bill after her death?
question: She had $20,000.00 in a checking account. She had me as a joint owner so that it could be split between my brother and me after she died. There is no probate, no estate, and I was named executor. We split the money, using a lot of it to take care of final arrangements. Am I obligated to pay the $1,000 dollars remaining on her hospital balance and the $150 ambulance bill?
question_tags: Business contracts,Bankruptcy,Joint accounts during bankruptcy,Debt,Bankruptcy and debt,Estate administration,Final arrangements and wills,Executor of will,Probate
answers: Normally, only the estate has to pay the bill, not the heirs. However, since you were a joint account holder, and that account was part of the estate, you must pay the bill.

If there was no probate, I am confused by your statement that you named as executor. Executors are named by a court as part of the probate process. Unless you signed a contract agreeing to pay, only assets of a probate estate are responsible for paying medical debt. Hope this perspective helps.
